column4: Here's an idea, if a linux application's source package has multiple compiling options that users might wanna use; then make them available as options when installing via deb or apt.  Otherwise us ubuntu users have to deal with a giant dependency mess, every godamn time we want to compile a newer version of a package from source.
If I wanna run my goddamn vlc player as root, that's my right!  I don't wanna have to recompile X11 from source in order to do so...

apt doesn't compile the application, apt only helps you to install precompiled applications, so someone would have to make an apt with each possible compile time configuration to accomplish what you are suggesting
